example.eg: The glass was set on the edge of the table.
example.egtrans: 那玻璃杯之前是摆在桌子边缘的。

example.eg: The home team had an edge over its opponents because it was taller.
example.egtrans: 主队身材更高，所以比其对手更有优势。

example.eg: Hit it with the edge of the tool, not the wide side.
example.egtrans: 用工具的棱边来敲打，不要用宽面。

example.eg: The knife had a fine edge that could cut anything.
example.egtrans: 那把刀很锋利，什么都切得动。

example.eg: The boy has a real edge that helps him in class.
example.egtrans: 那个男孩敏锐的思维对他在课堂上的表现大有帮助。

example.eg: The edge of the knife was ten centimetres long.
example.egtrans: 这把刀的刀刃有十厘米长。

example.eg: There is a path along the edge up there.
example.egtrans: 那边的山梁上有一条小路蜿蜒而上。

example.eg: Mark wanted to sit closer to Julie, so he edged toward her.
example.egtrans: 马克想坐得离朱莉近一点，所以慢慢挪动着靠近她。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 慢慢移动, 徐徐移动

example.eg: Edge the board so it will fit the open space tightly.
I have mown the lawn, now I need to edge it.
The cook edged her knife before cutting the meat.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 磨利, 磨快, 使锐利

example.eg: I tried to edge away from the drunk man on the bus.

dsense.name: edge [sb] out, edge [sth] out, edge out [sb], edge out [sth]
at the cutting edge of [sth], on the cutting edge of [sth]

example.eg: In 1440 Gutenberg's printing press was at the cutting edge of technology.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 走在...的前端, 处于...的前沿

example.eg: My desk has a bevelled edge.
Despite fencing and warning signs posted all along the cliff edge, at least one person a year ignores the danger and falls to his death.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 悬崖边缘, 悬崖峭壁

example.eg: This cutting-edge hydrogen motor will revolutionize the auto industry.
example.egtrans: 这种先进的氢动力发动机将彻底改变汽车行业。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 尖端的，前沿的，最先进的

example.eg: Cosmology is the cutting edge of modern science.
example.egtrans: 宇宙学是现代科学的前沿。

example.eg: The climber edged his way along the narrow ledge in the cliff face.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 慢慢走, 溜达, 踱步

example.eg: He always uses superior materials in order to have an edge on the competition.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 占优势, 具有优势, 拥有有利条件

example.eg: The knife edge was sharp and cut through the thick vegetables with ease.
A knife's edge is generally very sharp.
Mainframe computers used to be the leading edge of technology.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 技术前沿，领先地位, 飞机的机翼前缘

example.eg: The jet lost a 2.4 metre long section of the tail wing's leading edge after takeoff.

dsense.name: leading-edge
dsense.guideword: figurative (at the forefront: of a trend)

example.eg: Louise likes to take risks and live on the edge.
That strange sound set me on edge.
example.egtrans: 那个奇怪的声响让我焦躁不安。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 紧张, 激动, 焦躁不安

example.eg: She was on edge, waiting for her exam results.
example.egtrans: 她很紧张地等待着考试结果。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 紧张的, 激动的, 焦躁不安的

example.eg: Peter was worried that the cup might fall, for it stood on the edge of the table.
3D technology is on the edge of movie-making techniques.
Alpine skiers are always on the edge of losing control.

dsense.name: on the edge of your seat

trans_examp.trans_cn: 特别兴奋, 兴奋到坐不住

example.eg: Hunger pushed the little girl over the edge and she stole a loaf of bread from the bakery.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 让...崩溃, 将...推向绝望
在…的边缘，在危险状态中，濒临（不安全状况）
让...感到不舒服, 让...牙根发酸
化解...的感觉, 纾解...的情绪

example.eg: We're on the trailing edge of some really bad weather.
